intro: Sagraea tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled sagraea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a distinctive four-angled stem. Sagraea tetragona is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
